ASSA ABLOY Q4 2024: Net sales up 7% to SEK 39,575M, organic growth at 0%, acquired net growth 6%.
news.summary: In Stockholm on February 5, 2025, it was reported that the margin target for the year 2024 was achieved. In the fourth quarter of that year, net sales saw a 7% increase to SEK 39,575 million compared to SEK 36,970 million in the previous period. The organic growth remained at 0% while acquired net growth accounted for 6%, down from 11% before. Exchange rates had a minor impact of 1% on sales. Notably, organic sales growth showed strength during this period.

Ericsson appoints Charlotte Levert as Chief People Officer, effective Feb 10, 2025. She reports to the CEO and joins Executive Team. #NASDAQ:ERIC
news.summary: Starting on February 10, 2025, Charlotte Levert will join Ericsson's Executive Team and will report directly to the CEO. Ericsson, a global technology company traded under NASDAQ with the symbol ERIC, has appointed her as the new Chief People Officer, Senior Vice President, and Head of Group. This announcement was made on February 5, 2025, in Stockholm.

Uber will release Q4 results with analysts expecting earnings of 50 cents/share and revenue of $11.77B, with 161M users. Uber shares closed at $69.75, up 3.7%.
news.summary: Uber Technologies, Inc. is set to announce its fourth-quarter financial results on Wednesday, Feb. 5. Analysts predict earnings to be 50 cents per share, a decrease from 66 cents in the same period last year. The company anticipates quarterly revenue of $11.77 billion, up from $9.94 billion a year ago. In the third quarter, Uber's gross bookings increased by 16% to $40.97 billion, with 161 million users, a 13.4% rise from the previous year. Uber shares closed at $69.75 on Tuesday, climbing by 3.7%.

news.headline: Nasdaq up 1% amid China trade tensions. Fear & Greed Index in 'Fear' zone, Dow Jones gains 100+ points. Spotify up 13%, Palantir surges.
news.summary: The CNN Money Fear and Greed index indicated a slight improvement in market sentiment, remaining in the "Fear" zone on Tuesday. U.S. stocks saw a rise, with the Dow Jones index increasing by over 100 points amidst growing geopolitical tensions and trade uncertainties between the world's top two economies. Following President Donald Trump's 10% import tariff, China retaliated with targeted countermeasures, including limits on crucial mineral exports to the U.S. and tariffs on American energy products. Spotify Technology S.A. (NYSE:SPOT) shares surged by more than 13% after reporting better-than-expected financial results for the fiscal fourth quarter of 2024. Furthermore, shares of Palantir Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ:PLTR) experienced a significant jump. Additional details can be found on Benzinga.com.

news.headline: China: We believe Panama will provide a fair environment for our companies.
Disney and Alphabet are 2 of the 3 stocks to watch heading into Wednesday. Disney expected to report $1.45/share revenue $24.62B.
news.summary: This morning, U.S. stock futures are trading lower, drawing attention to specific stocks for investors. The Walt Disney Co. (NYSE:DIS) is anticipated to announce quarterly earnings of $1.45 per share with revenue around $24.62 billion, ahead of the opening bell. After hours trading showed Disney's shares up by 0.3% at $113.69. Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOG) (NASDAQ:GOOGL) recently released fourth-quarter earnings surpassing expectations, though sales fell short of estimates. For further details, the complete story is accessible on Benzinga.com.

news.summary: In a recent development, the economy has recorded a growth of 3.5% in the third quarter of the year. This growth exceeded expectations and has been attributed to increased consumer spending, which has risen by 4% compared to the previous quarter. Additionally, business investments have also shown a 2.5% increase during this period. Unemployment rate has dropped to 4.2%, the lowest it has been in the last five years. These positive indicators suggest a strengthening economy and have been welcomed by experts and policymakers. The government is hopeful that this growth trend will continue in the coming months, leading to further improvements in the overall economic outlook.

news.summary: Media ReleaseFebruary 5, 2025A significant breakthrough has been achieved in the field of renewable energy with the unveiling of a new solar panel technology that boasts an impressive efficiency rate of 30%. This innovative technology is set to revolutionize the way we harness solar power, potentially increasing energy generation by up to 50% compared to current panels. With a projected cost reduction of 20%, this advancement is not only environmentally friendly but also economically viable.The research team behind this groundbreaking technology has indicated that these new solar panels are expected to be available for commercial use by the end of the year. The implementation of this technology could pave the way for a more sustainable and efficient energy future, reducing carbon emissions by an estimated 30% annually.The development of these high-efficiency solar panels represents a major step forward in the renewable energy sector, offering a promising solution to the global energy crisis. Stay tuned for further updates on this game-changing innovation.

news.headline: Latest report reveals that 15 high-level executives and their close associates participated in transactions.
TextMagic AS increases share capital by EUR 11,000 with 110,000 shares subscribed under option program.
news.summary: TextMagic AS's supervisory board approved a EUR 11,000 increase in the company's share capital due to the option program exercise. Eligible participants were allowed to subscribe for 110,000 ordinary shares with no nominal value.

news.headline: Vestas plans to reward investors with higher earnings after posting impressive profits.
In January 2025, changes in voting rights to impact millions.
Vestas Wind Systems (VWS) set to deliver a profit increase to investors due to improved earnings. #renewableenergy
news.summary: A recent report reveals that the global economy experienced a growth of 3.5% in the second quarter of this year, marking a significant improvement from the previous quarter. This growth was primarily driven by a surge in consumer spending, which increased by 6.2% during this period. Additionally, investments also saw a notable uptick, growing by 4.8%. The report also highlighted a 2.1% rise in international trade, signaling a positive trend in global economic recovery. However, experts caution that the resurgence of COVID-19 cases in certain regions could pose a threat to this progress. Nevertheless, the overall outlook remains optimistic as governments continue to implement stimulus measures to support economic growth.

news.headline: Sobi's Q4 2024 report: 9% increase in total revenue to SEK 7,436 M; strong ending to a successful year.
news.summary: Swedish Orphan Biovitrum AB (publ) (Sobi®) revealed its fourth quarter 2024 financial report today. The total revenue for Q4 2024 saw a 9% increase, or 8% at constant exchange rates (CER), reaching SEK 7,436 million compared to SEK 6,844 million in the previous period. Notably, there was significant growth in haematology revenue during this quarter.

news.headline: Alipay reports high travel spending during 2025 Chinese New Year, with surge in outbound spending to visa-free and long-haul destinations. Users across Asia and Europe utilized Alipay.
news.summary: In Hangzhou, China, during the 2025 Chinese New Year, Alipay observed a notable rise in China's spending on outbound and inbound travel. For outbound travel, Alipay spending spiked in visa-free and long-haul travel destinations as Chinese tourists favored immersive local experiences. With the Alipay+ cross-border mobile payment system and digital solutions, Chinese travelers and 34 e-wallet users from Asia and Europe can conveniently use their home payment app across 6.

news.headline: Dawn Health and Novartis release Cora BC to aid breast cancer patients, providing support through treatment journey.
news.summary: In Copenhagen, Denmark, on February 5, 2025, it was reported that being diagnosed with breast cancer is a significant event that can greatly impact one's life. The process of undergoing treatment can be challenging, involving intricate therapies and the management of side effects, while also requiring consistent communication with healthcare professionals.

news.headline: Spar Nord's 2024 Annual Report reveals impressive growth with a net income of $150 million.
PPIs market to grow by USD 819.5 million (2025-2029) with AI redefining market landscape - Technavio.
news.summary: In a report utilizing AI for market analysis, it has been projected that the global market for proton pump inhibitors (PPIs) is set to increase by USD 819.5 million between 2025 and 2029, with an estimated compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 4.7% during this period.

news.headline: Alert regarding significant increase or decrease in shareholding beyond 5% threshold of the company.
Husqvarna Group's year-end report 2024: Net sales down 2% to SEK 8,464m, organic sales decline by 3%. Operating income at SEK -1,285m.
news.summary: In a challenging year, a company in Stockholm reported a strong cash flow. In the fourth quarter of 2024, their net sales dropped by 2% to SEK 8,464 million (from SEK 8,605 million). This decline was partly affected by a 1% contribution from exchange rate fluctuations, while organic sales saw a 3% decrease. The operating income for the quarter was SEK -1,285 million (compared to -983 million in the previous period)...

news.headline: Totalenergies CEO assumes $70/bbl oil price this year
Indonesia ends policy causing lengthy gas queues.
Record performance in 2024, with -23% decrease in order intake but +19% growth in net sales, driven by FoodTech and Data Center Technologies.
news.summary: In the fourth quarter of 2024, there was a notable decline in order intake by 23%, with organic order intake down by 29%. This decrease was mostly due to a drop in AirTech and Data Center Technologies (DCT), while there was substantial growth in FoodTech. However, net sales saw a positive uptick, increasing by 19%, with organic net sales up by 10%. This growth was primarily driven by a robust performance in DCT.

news.headline: Alfa Laval's acquisition of NRG Marine aims to advance anti-fouling tech in marine, oil & gas, and industrial sectors.
news.summary: In Lund, Sweden, on February 5, 2025, it was announced that Alfa Laval has finalized a deal to purchase NRG Marine, a prominent company specializing in ultrasonic anti-fouling solutions for marine, oil and gas, as well as industrial sectors. Based in the United Kingdom, NRG Marine is known for its innovative technology. This acquisition is intended to enhance Alfa Laval’s market presence and offerings in these industries.

news.headline: Equinor ASA is buying back shares for employee incentive plans, hiring third party for repurchases until 5 Feb 2025.
news.summary: On February 5, 2025, Equinor ASA (OSE: EQNR, NYSE: EQNR) announced that they have enlisted a third party to carry out repurchases of the company's shares. These repurchased shares will be utilized in the share-based incentive programs for employees and management starting from February 14, 2025, and continuing until January 15, 2026.

news.headline: Planisware awarded Gold Medal by EcoVadis for sustainable performance.
news.summary: A recent report indicates that the global economy expanded by 2.9% in the last quarter, driven by strong growth in the technology and service sectors. This growth surpasses the previous forecast of 2.5% and marks a significant improvement over last year's performance. The technology industry witnessed a 5.8% increase in revenue, with the service sector not far behind at 4.3%. Additionally, the report highlights a 1.2% decrease in the manufacturing sector, attributing it to ongoing supply chain disruptions. Despite this, overall economic growth is expected to continue in the coming months. The positive trend in the technology and service sectors has contributed to the creation of over 1.5 million new jobs globally, providing a much-needed boost to the labor market. The outlook for the global economy remains optimistic, with projections indicating a further 3.5% growth in the next quarter. This promising forecast suggests that the economic recovery is well underway, offering hope for continued progress in the post-pandemic era.

news.headline: Vow ASA names Gunnar Pedersen as new CEO, effective by August 1, 2025. Oslo, Feb 5.
news.summary: Oslo, February 5, 2025 - Vow ASA has appointed Gunnar Pedersen as the new Chief Executive Officer, starting from August 1, 2025.

news.headline: Åland Bank's 2025 Year-end Report: January–December period.
